witness_patterns.name: Unarmed Observer
witness_patterns.description: Character present but carries no weapons in violent setting

witness_patterns.name: Diplomatic Witness
witness_patterns.description: Authority figure who observes helplessly as events unfold

witness_patterns.name: Young Observer
witness_patterns.description: Junior figure (midshipman, child) who survives to tell tale

witness_patterns.name: Afflicted Witness
witness_patterns.description: Character suffering from curse/disease who can only observe

power_patterns.name: Truth as Weapon
power_patterns.description: Character gains power by exposing hidden truths

power_patterns.name: Institutional Authority
power_patterns.description: Power derived from rank and position

power_patterns.name: Survival Leadership
power_patterns.description: Authority emerges from practical survival skills

relationship_patterns.name: Witnessed Destruction
relationship_patterns.description: Observer present at crucial destructive event

relationship_patterns.name: Affliction Bond
relationship_patterns.description: Character bound to curse or disease

element_extraction_patterns.name: HTML Structure Parsing
element_extraction_patterns.description: Pre-formatted HTML with left/right column structure
element_extraction_patterns.structure: Original text left, parsed elements right

degradation_patterns.name: Authority Dissolution
degradation_patterns.description: Command structure breaks down under pressure

degradation_patterns.name: Temporal Degradation
degradation_patterns.description: Time itself flows wrong, causing decay

degradation_patterns.name: Truth Erosion
degradation_patterns.description: Lies and pretense dissolve under scrutiny

field_formatting_patterns.name: ForeignKey Format
field_formatting_patterns.description: Single UUID string for one-to-one relations

field_formatting_patterns.name: ManyToMany Format
field_formatting_patterns.description: Array of UUID strings for many-to-many relations

field_formatting_patterns.name: Optional ForeignKey
field_formatting_patterns.description: Can be null for optional relations

special_patterns.name: Title-Institution Binding
special_patterns.description: Titles always link to both holders and institutions
special_patterns.implementation: Create Title with holders[] and institutions[] arrays

special_patterns.name: Technology Duality
special_patterns.description: Technology exists as both Construct (system) and Object (device)
special_patterns.implementation: Create Construct for system, Object for physical manifestation

special_patterns.name: Collective Evolution
special_patterns.description: Groups can split or merge based on events

special_patterns.name: Cascading Relations
special_patterns.description: One relation triggers creation of others
special_patterns.implementation: Authority creates service, conflict creates alliances

edge_cases_resolved.solution: Use most formal name, track aliases in description
edge_cases_resolved.example: Judge Holden vs The Judge vs bald man

edge_cases_resolved.solution: Create Collective, link members when known
Use Phenomenon for forces, Event for occurrences
edge_cases_resolved.example: Storms as Phenomenon, specific storm as Event
